poem:
**The Cinematic Congregation**

In Wes Anderson's realm, they gather—  
stars drawn by gravity,  
a celestial procession of players,  
their fame a constellation  
of bright, transient tales  
woven by the loom of his lens.  
Yet what narrative beckons me,  
a voice from the shadows,  
to remain unseen  
among such luminous company?
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Who’s who in The Phoenician Scheme? Meet the cast of the new Wes Anderson film Among the many hallmarks of the films of Wes Anderson, perhaps one defining feature is the director’s ability to pull together ludicrously starry ensemble casts. A-listers jump at the chance of being a part of his films. And the big names who enter his orbit rarely leave, returning again and again. “Who is in the new Wes Anderson film?” doesn’t". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
